item.title: R to @MsJudyYu: Sorry you're getting grief - people are stupid. Fwiw I'm flying right now, and the 3M 3-part masks (n95 or ffp3/n99) feel *way* better sealed than the std N95s. Bit awkward putting on/off with headstraps, but more comfortable for long journeys.
item.dc:creator: @56Hz
item.description: Sorry you're getting grief - people are stupid. Fwiw I'm flying right now, and the 3M 3-part masks (n95 or ffp3/n99) feel *way* better sealed than the std N95s. Bit awkward putting on/off with headstraps, but more comfortable for long journeys.

item.title: R to @bat020: I'm now more obsessed with the beautiful geometric colour patterns you make than whether you actually solve it. Also, android thinks "patterns" might be "Oostende".
item.dc:creator: @56Hz
item.description: I'm now more obsessed with the beautiful geometric colour patterns you make than whether you actually solve it. Also, android thinks "patterns" might be "Oostende".

item.title: I showed my kids folks catching waves right under the cliffs at the slot, steamer lane. I think my work is done.
item.dc:creator: @56Hz
item.description: I showed my kids folks catching waves right under the cliffs at the slot, steamer lane. I think my work is done.

item.title: R to @bat020: I haven't yet to see an @AOC policy or statement I disagree with, and I'm pretty disagreeable. What I like even more is the tactics - she never fights on the enemies territory or within the boundaries set out. Sharp AF. The Democrats are far too soft, and she isn't.
item.dc:creator: @56Hz
item.description: I haven't yet to see an @AOC policy or statement I disagree with, and I'm pretty disagreeable. What I like even more is the tactics - she never fights on the enemies territory or within the boundaries set out. Sharp AF. The Democrats are far too soft, and she isn't.

item.title: R to @bat020: Holding on to the last letter like a liferaft!
item.dc:creator: @56Hz
item.description: Holding on to the last letter like a liferaft!

item.title: R to @1frazzled1: I'd like to believe that will work. My gut tells me that wrt Ireland, people will either need to be *told* what to do - or be scared in to what to do. That's not how I wish it to be, just how I suspect it may be...
item.dc:creator: @56Hz
item.description: I'd like to believe that will work. My gut tells me that wrt Ireland, people will either need to be *told* what to do - or be scared in to what to do. That's not how I wish it to be, just how I suspect it may be...

item.title: R to @56Hz: They then constantly juggle prices and locations to maximise overall margin, by flushing out your price sensitivity, and putting everything where the overall margin will hit max. Your happyness only matters if lots of you move to another retailer. (2/2)
item.dc:creator: @56Hz
item.description: They then constantly juggle prices and locations to maximise overall margin, by flushing out your price sensitivity, and putting everything where the overall margin will hit max. Your happyness only matters if lots of you move to another retailer. (2/2)

item.title: R to @funkdvoid: Because they track population level shopping habits with barcodes scanned, personal habits with loyalty schemes (buying your subconscious with discounts), and track your movements in store by your phone polling for Bluetooth and WiFi, if they are sharp. (1/2)
item.dc:creator: @56Hz
item.description: Because they track population level shopping habits with barcodes scanned, personal habits with loyalty schemes (buying your subconscious with discounts), and track your movements in store by your phone polling for Bluetooth and WiFi, if they are sharp. (1/2)

item.title: R to @jburnmurdoch: Great thread, interesting conclusions, thank you! Question - is there any data of what hospitalisation rate (as % of confirmed cases) looks like with BA5? Wondering is there data showing it's more dangerous (or not) per infection from anywhere?
item.dc:creator: @56Hz
item.description: Great thread, interesting conclusions, thank you! Question - is there any data of what hospitalisation rate (as % of confirmed cases) looks like with BA5? Wondering is there data showing it's more dangerous (or not) per infection from anywhere?

item.title: R to @BinitaKane: Mmm yes and no. After a very strong first pandemic year of clear public direction built around mandates and very tough lockdowns, Ireland has slipped into "suit yourself" comms. I'm briefly in North California, mask wearing here not great, but far higher than in Ireland right now
item.dc:creator: @56Hz
item.description: Mmm yes and no. After a very strong first pandemic year of clear public direction built around mandates and very tough lockdowns, Ireland has slipped into "suit yourself" comms. I'm briefly in North California, mask wearing here not great, but far higher than in Ireland right now

item.title: RT by @56Hz: Scotland holds very different values than the United Kingdom. We are a nation that wants to uphold our human rights, uphold our connection and membership of the European Union, and truly be welcoming to new Scots. Please donâ€™t think that the United Kingdom speaks for Scotland.
item.dc:creator: @ionafyfe
item.description: Scotland holds very different values than the United Kingdom. We are a nation that wants to uphold our human rights, uphold our connection and membership of the European Union, and truly be welcoming to new Scots. Please donâ€™t think that the United Kingdom speaks for Scotland.

item.title: R to @bat020: Markets are always overbought and oversold right? The biggest drivers seem to be hope, fear, and momentum chasing algos - not a recipe for rationality. I'm interested in the big headcount cuts across tech - everyone seemed to smell trouble at the same time.
item.dc:creator: @56Hz
item.description: Markets are always overbought and oversold right? The biggest drivers seem to be hope, fear, and momentum chasing algos - not a recipe for rationality. I'm interested in the big headcount cuts across tech - everyone seemed to smell trouble at the same time.

item.title:
RT by @56Hz: The direct evidence of a reservoir has been found- persistent spike in the blood at one year
The secondary evidence- the naive t cell depletion- this is bad. The sloughing could progress
we need more antivirals imo
item.dc:creator: @fitterhappierAJ
item.description:
The direct evidence of a reservoir has been found- persistent spike in the blood at one year

The secondary evidence- the naive t cell depletion- this is bad. The sloughing could progress

we need more antivirals imo
